intro: Limonium parvibracteatum, commonly known as the narrow-bract sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in saline or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments. Its narrow bracts and showy flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Limonium parvibracteatum is often used in coastal landscaping due to its drought and salt tolerance.
